subject: Programming
title: Design Patterns
description: A micro-lesson that makes Design Patterns usable.

hook.text: By the 1990s, programmers kept solving the same problems with different messy solutions.

buildup.text: Four authors published Design Patterns, cataloging 23 reusable solutions to common problems.

discovery.text: Patterns like Observer, Factory, and Singleton gave teams a shared vocabulary.

twist.text: Over time, developers over-applied patterns, making simple code needlessly complex.

climax.text: The best programmers learned when not to use a pattern. Simplicity still wins.

punchline.text: Knowing the pattern means knowing when to skip it.

quiz.question: How many design patterns did the original Gang of Four book catalog?
